summary: This document is a response to a grand jury subpoena in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell, listing non-confidential materials produced. It includes an index of deposition transcripts for Jeffrey Epstein and other witnesses, jail visitor logs, flight logs, police reports, and audio/video interview files from the state case against Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the case; his deposition transcripts, jail visitor logs, flight logs, and numerous audio/video interview files are listed as produced materials.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Deposition transcripts from July 29, 2009 and August 7, 2009 are listed as part of the produced materials.

persons.name: Juan Alessi
persons.context: Deposition transcripts from September 8, 2009 (Volumes I and II) are listed as part of the produced materials.

persons.name: Michael Reiter
persons.context: Deposition transcripts from November 23, 2009 (Volumes I and II) are listed as part of the produced materials.

persons.name: Janusz Banasiak
persons.context: A deposition transcript from February 16, 2010 is listed as part of the produced materials.

persons.name: Joseph Recarey
persons.context: Deposition transcripts from March 19, 2010 (Volumes I and II) are listed as part of the produced materials.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subpoena response is filed in the case against her (15 Civ. 7433 (RWS), S.D.N.Y.).

connections.description: The document is a subpoena response in the case against Maxwell, and it lists materials related to the Epstein cases, indicating their legal and alleged conspiratorial connection.
Rodriguez's deposition transcripts are listed among materials related to the Epstein cases, suggesting he was a witness with knowledge of Epstein's activities.
Alessi's deposition transcripts are listed among materials related to the Epstein cases, suggesting he was a staff member or associate who provided testimony.
Detective Recarey's deposition transcripts are listed, indicating he was involved in the law enforcement investigation of Epstein.

events.title: BSF ShareFile Materials Produced

keyFacts: The document is an index of materials produced in response to a grand jury subpoena in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, showing the scope of evidence collected related to Jeffrey Epstein.
It lists multiple deposition dates for Jeffrey Epstein spanning from April 2009 to April 2010, indicating extensive pre-trial questioning.
The produced materials include jail visitor logs and aircraft flight logs for Jeffrey Epstein, which are often key in tracking associations and movements.
The response includes extensive audio and video interview files labeled 'State v. Epstein,' comprising at least 24 parts, suggesting a large volume of investigative media.
Witness depositions include staff (Juan Alessi, Janusz Banasiak), an associate (Alfredo Rodriguez), and law enforcement (Det. Joseph Recarey, former police chief Michael Reiter).
